headline: Press Release: Sanofi and Regeneron’s Dupixent approved in Japan for children aged 6 to 11 years with bronchial asthma
summary: Sanofi and Regeneron’s Dupixent approved in Japan for children aged 6 to 11 years with bronchial asthma Approval based on global phase 3 program in children demonstrating Dupixent significantly reduced exacerbations (by 54% to 65%) and improved lung function compared to placebo (by 4.68% to 5.32%) Dupixent is the first and only biologic medicine to demonstrate improved lung function in this young patient group in a randomized phase 3 study, and inhibits IL-4 and IL-13, two key and central driver

content.title: Press Release: Sanofi and Regeneron’s Dupixent approved in Japan for children aged 6 to 11 years with bronchial asthma
content.summary: Sanofi and Regeneron’s Dupixent approved in Japan for children aged 6 to 11 years with bronchial asthma Approval based on global phase 3 program in children demonstrating Dupixent significantly reduced exacerbations (by 54% to 65%) and improved lung function compared to placebo (by 4.68% to 5.32%) Dupixent is the first and only biologic medicine to demonstrate improved lung function in this young patient group in a randomized phase 3 study, and inhibits IL-4 and IL-13, two key and central driver

headline: Dupixent® (dupilumab) Approved in Japan for Children Aged 6 to 11 Years with Bronchial Asthma
summary: Approval based on global Phase 3 program in children demonstrating Dupixent significantly reduced exacerbations (by 54% to 65%) and improved lung function (by 4.68% to 5.32%) compared to placebo Dupixent is the first and only biologic medicine to demonstrate improved lung function in this young patient group in a randomized Phase 3 trial, and inhibits IL-4 and IL-13, two key and central drivers of type 2 inflammation TARRYTOWN, N.Y. and PARIS, Dec. 23, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Regeneron Pharmace

content.title: Dupixent® (dupilumab) Approved in Japan for Children Aged 6 to 11 Years with Bronchial Asthma
content.summary: Approval based on global Phase 3 program in children demonstrating Dupixent significantly reduced exacerbations (by 54% to 65%) and improved lung function (by 4.68% to 5.32%) compared to placebo Dupixent is the first and only biologic medicine to demonstrate improved lung function in this young patient group in a randomized Phase 3 trial, and inhibits IL-4 and IL-13, two key and central drivers of type 2 inflammation TARRYTOWN, N.Y. and PARIS, Dec. 23, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Regeneron Pharmace
